ratings.comment: concert choir should be good. But it's not. This comes back to BT. She's late and disorganized. She blames everyone else for her problems and mistakes. My teacher loved her in the 1990s but she is not the same teacher now. If I had a choice in my schedule I wouldve sang in a different group.
I really wanted to like her. But she has no respect for snyone else's time. This semester we did 2 songs with professors and she was late to their rehearsals. It was embarrassing.

Knowledgeable and exacting, funny and caring. Runs rehearsals fairly efficiently. I've been in many choirs (including a major symphony chorus) & BT has been one of my favorite directors. Expects a lot from students & often programs too large a volume of music to learn comfortably, but we usually figure it out. Had her for 3 yrs of Concert Choir.
She made me hate choir.

Professor Taylor is great. She is kind toward her students unless you are chatty. She definitely knows her stuff. Often she is late to choir and the grad students start on warm ups. She often misplaces her music. But she is always very funny and upbeat and has great feedback musically. Does require a lot of time tho and expects choir to be priority
Professor Taylor is incredibly knowledgeable, approachable, witty, funny, and inspirational. She makes choir a joy and time flies in her class!
I was hoping for a great choral experience.  But the performances were musically very sloppy.  I decided that the Choral Union was not worth my time.
Fabulous conductor. Funny witty and very bright enjoyed all my semesters and have gone on to sing with her in other venues
I sang in Choral Union for 2 years.  My experience was not good.  Professor Taylor is a nice person.  But the Choral Union Choir never achieved a very high musical level in performance.

BT is fantastic in training a choir of 50 members to learn difficult repertoire in short periods of time. She likes to have fun in her own ways, but her number one goal is to please the choir as a whole and the individual singer. Very flexible as far as voice parts and standing order. Understands conflicts and works with you to fix them. Fun class!

BT is honestly the most fun person I've ever worked with musically. She knows what she is talking about and knows how she wants everything to sound. She is kind, fun, silly, and still gets (most of) the work done that she intends to. You can't help but love BT.

Good: She is a fantastic conductor, She is mostly understanding of conflicts, and she performs hard literature that makes you look good.           Not so Good: Time is not of her essence so don't expect her to come to class on time,VERY disorganized, Susceptible to throwing tantrums and performing pieces that aren't ready

Professor Taylor is very enthusiastic and makes singing what it should be - enjoyable.  Your grade is literally based only on attendance, so if you just show up, you don't have to worry about your grade and can concentrate on learning your part and enjoying your time singing!  Choral Union is a lot of fun - I'd highly recommend it.
She's very friendly, quirky, & knowledgeable! Everyone loves BT!
She's a little scatterbrained but I still think she's awesome.  She reminds me a lot of my old choir teacher in high school. she's really friendly too, which is a plus

Horribly disorganized? yes. Unorthodox? yes. Talks way too much at concerts? yes. Bad driver? you bet. But still my favorite prof. I love singing with BT despite the headaches. She's amazingly knowledgeable and understanding of conflicts. If only she would add a little variety to her warm-ups I'd be content.

I sang under Beverly's baton in both concert choir and choral union, and we performed really good literature. (Bach B Minor, Tallis Lamentations, Martin Mass, Verdi Req...and more...) Always the most clear? No  Always musical and intelligent?  Yes   Strangely humorous?  You bet.   If you sing with her, as I did almost 10 years ago, you remember it.

Playing for Beverly is NOT a typical "choral-conductor-trying-to-deal-with-an-orchestra" situation.  She has excellent technique, is very musical and clear and insightful in her directions.  Not only that, but she is courteous to all involved, which can't be said of many conductors.  Very easy to work with & a highlight of my UW experience.
I don't care what anyone says. I love BT.
Old and boring.  She thinks she's hilarious and she just isn't.

While she is very knowledgeable and would make a fabulous musicologist, she is unable to effectively communicate what she wants from her choir.  Her conducting gestures are a terrible eyesore for singer and audience member.  I expected much more from the Director of Choral Activities at one of the nation's leading higher education institutions.

An amazing person and teacher - wealth of knowledge, excellent communicator, great conductor - as a horn player, I found her to be a wonderful conductor, and to have sympathy for my inability to hear pitches  not in F!  Took her graduate conducting seminar 3 times and learned so much to apply to future teaching-got me over my conducting phobias!
been in choral union for two semesters and have nothing bad to say at all.  we do some really difficult music and yet she always has us more than prepared by concert time.  also quite funny.
Splendid conductor yet very human and fun to work with
Not flexible.  Expects choir to be everyone's lives.  However, she is very compassionate towards members with physical challenges, so she does have a heart.

Demanding, but very knowledgeable. I tend to crack up more than anyone else in the choir, but she is hilarious when in a good mood. Gets much more serious approaching concert, of course. The examples she sings aren't always the prettiest, but her intents are clear. "Victory for vivisectionists!"
Just plain bad.....
No Comments

Can we say PSYCHO?? She is generally an excellent choral director.. however after this year's concert choir tour I never, ever want to see her responsible for anything ever again. Plus she makes mean faces when you sing. As in horrible grimaces.
